result.correct_soap_O:
Nervous: Normal vision and proprioception.
Heart: ​Bradycardia.
result.correct_soap_P:
1) Ordered echocardiogram and CT angiogram to rule out clots in heart and neck region.
2) ​Ordered sleep study to check for sleep apnea. Discussed that untreated sleep apnea increases the risk of stroke.
3) ​Prescribed baby aspirin 81 mg daily and simvastatin cholesterol medications.
Discussed the effects of CVA in parieto-occipital region on left-sided vision and art. Informed that he is recovering from the CVA.
4) ​Discussed the importance of taking medications on time and exercising regularly could prevent clot formation in the arteries and reduce the chances of CVA by 90%.
5) ​Discussed that some detailed analysis would be required to prevent cardiac arrhythmia, if any untoward incident happened.​​
result.correct_soap_A: Cerebrovascular accident in right parieto-occipital region.
result.correct_soap_S:
The patient presents today for a post stroke follow-up visit. He had problems with vision earlier. He has had a CT scan and takes statins at night. His primary care physician has not prescribed anti-hypertensive medication.
ROS: Snoring.​
Sochx: ​The patient and his brother live in another town and are staying here for a week. He wants to complete the diagnostic tests within a week.
